program.name: Medicaid for Pregnant Women
program.description_short: Free public health insurance for pregnant women
program.description:
Free public health insurance for pregnant women. 

If you qualify for this program, you will have full Medicaid benefits during pregnancy and for the first 12 months of the baby's life. You may get prenatal care like doctor visits and vitamins. You may also get benefits to cover the cost of labor and delivery.

Your baby will qualify for check-ups and care for the first 12 months of life. 

Medicaid helps pay for check-ups, doctor visits, and emergency care. It also covers immunizations, medicine, and dental care. 

If you qualify, you will likely choose a STAR managed health care program.

Time to Apply is based on submitting an application in Your Texas Benefits. You may save time when you apply for several benefits with one application.

On average, it takes up to 45 days to get approved.

documents.text: Doctor or clinic statement confirming pregnancy or HHSC pregnancy verification
